intro: Hieracium virenticeps, commonly known as the green-headed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal rosettes of lanceolate leaves. Its bright yellow flower heads consist of numerous small florets arranged in a disc-like structure. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
